passage_text: Preventive medicine counseling services for. family planning counseling (31 – 45 minutes). E&C visits billed in association with CPT-4 code 99401, 99402, or 99403 must be billed with a U6 modifier to indicate individual family planning counseling provided during the office visit. The following CPT-4 procedure codes will accommodate an E&M code with modifier 25 when a significant, separately identifiable E&M service is provided by the same clinician on the same date of the procedure.

Laboratory, medication and contraceptive supply codes, as well as certain CPT-4 procedure codes, may be billed on the same date of service as an E&M CPT-4 office visit code. The following CPT-4 procedure codes will accommodate an E&M code with modifier 25 when a significant, separately identifiable E&M service is provided by the same clinician on the same date of the procedure.

Example:If your practice normally closes at 4 p.m. on Fridays, but your physician sees a patient at 7 p.m. and conducts a level-three established patient visit, you should bill 99213 (for the E/M) and 99050 (for the after-hours visit). ... ... 99051:Concept and Scenario:-. It is my understanding that when you are open on the weekends with posted hours, you cannot bill for 99051 or 99050. If I understand your question, you are now open until 7 p.m. during the week and 10 a.m. until 12 p.m. on Saturdays.

Individual family planning counseling: Lasting up to 15 minutes. Provided by a clinician and/or counselor 99401U6:May not be billed with E&M codes nor with 99402U6 or 99403U6. Limited to two CPT-4 E&C code office visits (99401U6 – 99403U6) per client, per 30 days, per provider. The following CPT-4 procedure codes will accommodate an E&M code with modifier 25 when a significant, separately identifiable E&M service is provided by the same clinician on the same date of the procedure.

99050: 1  Applies to services supplied to a member by a PCP when the office is normally closed. 2  Document the special circumstances of the visit in the medical record. 3  Report CPT 99050 in addition to the basic service. 1 Applies to services supplied to a member by a PCP during regularly scheduled evening, weekend or holiday office hours. 2  Priority Health considers after hours to be any scheduled appointment after 5:00pm EST and prior to 8:00am EST. 3  Report CPT 99051

After hours procedure codes are not covered when the service is provided in a hospital emergency department, an inpatient hospital setting, outpatient hospital setting, or an urgent care facility (place of service codes 20, 21, 22, and 23). The reimbursement for each of these CPT codes will be $12.00. SCDHHS defines CPT code 99050 to mean all patients scheduled outside published business hours; this would not include a visit that was scheduled at 4:00 p.m. and the patient was not seen by the physician until 6:30 p.m. For CPT code 99051, SCDHHS defines evening hours to be any time after 6:00 p.m. and before 8:00 a.m.

... ... What is an After-hours Service:-. A patient is considered an after-hours patient only if he reports to the office after your normal office hours end — not when he presents during normal office hours and the appointment runs past closing time. It is my understanding that when you are open on the weekends with posted hours, you cannot bill for 99051 or 99050. If I understand your question, you are now open until 7 p.m. during the week and 10 a.m. until 12 p.m. on Saturdays.

CPT code 99051 is for services that are provided in the office during regularly schedule evening, weekend, or holiday hours. EVENING beginning is normally 5pm. CPT code 99050 is for services that are provided in the office other than regularly scheduled office hours, or days that the office is normally closed. I am hoping that you can help me try and make sure that we utilize this code correctly and begin to get reimbursed for it. They allow for $38 per weekend visit on the EOBs but have used a number of remarks to deny paying for the service.

Lori: So my doctors office changed their office hours to 10am-6pm on mondays, can I bill 99051 in additon to the regular CPT codes, (i,e. It is my understanding that when you are open on the weekends with posted hours, you cannot bill for 99051 or 99050. If I understand your question, you are now open until 7 p.m. during the week and 10 a.m. until 12 p.m. on Saturdays.
